summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Timothy Dorsch. The documents primarily focus on the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The testimonies and memoranda discuss electronic surveillance, potential communist influence, and the FBI's operational policies during these investigations. Since Timothy Dorsch is not mentioned, his role, connections, timeline, and significance in the JFK assassination context cannot be determined from these documents.
